results.title: Suez Canal
results.creator_credit: John Halas, Peter Hopkinson, Louis De Rochemont and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: A brief history of the Suez Canal, showing the way the Suez and Panama Canals shorten trade routes. Superb use of animation based on ancient Egyptian art, illustrates how the Pharaohs dug several canals in the area. Oil prints show work of De Lesseps in financing and building the present canal. Live photography briefly shows how the canal is operated and maintained.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Halas, Peter Hopkinson, Louis De Rochemont and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films

results.title: Sue and Mario: the Italian Australians
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
An introduction to the hybrid lifestyles resulting from the marriage of two second-generation Australians of different ethnic origins. Both Sue and Mario are second generation Australians. Sue’s family migrated from England, whilst Mario’s came from Italy. The couple live in Griffith, a N.S.W. rural community where more than fifty per cent of the population is of Italian descent. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Suddenly you're a parent
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Looks at the birth of a baby, examines the new born’s reflex abilities, and discusses the importance of movement and touch. The premature birth is also discussed.

results.title: Suddenly last summer (Eastbourne)
results.creator_credit: Clare Beavan, Shauna Brown and Channel Four
results.brief_description: Together with women from all over Britain and abroad, Tyneside comedienne “Hufty” travels to the Mecca of lesbian fandom, the Pilkington Glass Ladies of Tennis Championships in Eastbourne. For many of the women any sacrifice is worth the opportunity to see their idol, Martina Navratilova, in the flesh.

results.title: Suddenly last summer
results.creator_credit: Joseph L Mankiewicz, Sam Spiegel and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: From a Tennessee Williams play, an outrageous, melodramatic piece touching on madness, homosexual prostitution, incest, disease and cannibalism. Stars Elizabeth Taylor, Katherine Hepburn, Montgomery Clift. Adapted for the screen by Gore Vidal.

results.title: Suddenly [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lewis Allen, Robert Bassler and Libra Productions
results.brief_description: Set in a sleepy US town by the name of “Suddenly”, an attractive war widow and mother of young son “Pidge” is pursued by the local sheriff Todd Shaw (Sterling Hayden) with romance in mind. Todd gets word that the President of the United States is to make an impromptu visit to the town and the FBI arrive to set up a secure perimeter around the railway station. Overlooking the station is the home of the widow Ellen (Nancy Gates) and her father-in-law (James Gleason), an ex-secret service agent. The film becomes a hostage drama as three gangsters lead by John Barron (Frank Sinatra) attempt to assassinate the president with a rifle from the house on the hill. The film provides a commentary on the role of the hand-gun in a post-world war America. Because of the similarity of the plot to real life, the film was withdrawn from general distribution after the assassination of JFK. Part of a two-disc set, with one disc being an Audio CD. Also contains a booklet with information and photos of Frank Sinatra.

results.title: Sudden departure
results.creator_credit: Georges Dufaux, Marcel Martin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: When an infant or small child enters hospital, there can be dangerous emotional shock caused by separation from the mother. Filmed at a children’s hospital, this film examines the nature of the child’s deprivation. A psychiatrist discusses what parents can do to lessen fear and anxiety. (Awards: Cairo; La Plata.)

results.title: Sudan: a new vision
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Nychuat Deng
results.brief_description: A lot of people made sacrifices in an attempt to free South Sudan from civil war. Nychuat and her family now live in Australia but they are deeply connected to Sudan and in honour and respect for those that have made sacrifices, they work tirelessly to support the freedom movement in Sudan. This story explores Nychaut’s relationship with her two countries, Australia and Sudan.

results.title: Sudan dispute
results.creator_credit: J. Arthur Rank Organisation and This Modern Age
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “This Modern Age”
Discusses the dispute between Egypt and England over the future of the Anglo-Egyptian Sudan. As a background, it shows the nature of the peoples who inhabit the area and claims that improvements in health services, education and agriculture are the result of British administration.
